title: Program for Enhancing Mathematical Academic Self-Efficacy in Blended Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Individual digital device utilization for non-degree job competency enhancement

learning_goals: Learners can improve self-efficacy in mathematical problem-solving by over 30% in blended learning environments

Select three self-directed learning strategies (e.g., time management matrix, goal-setting checklist, feedback journal) in online (video lectures, LMS) and offline (lab, group discussion) environments, achieving over 80% execution rates and resolving learning gaps within two weeks during transitions.

Maintain over 80% satisfaction in learning motivation surveys through peer feedback sessions (twice weekly) and instructor 1:1 coaching (weekly), successfully solving at least eight of ten practical problem-solving tasks.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
